To make meme theory a formal mathematical framework, several additional components would need to be developed and integrated into the existing theory. Some possible steps towards this goal might include:

1. Defining more precise and rigorous mathematical models for the concepts of meme and description. This could involve using formal definitions, axioms, and theorem statements to clearly specify the meanings and properties of these concepts, as well as identifying any underlying assumptions or implicit constraints that might be relevant.
2. Developing mathematical tools and techniques for analyzing and manipulating memes and descriptions. This could include methods for comparing, combining, and decomposing memes and descriptions, as well as methods for studying the structure and dynamics of meme cultures and the ways in which memes spread and evolve over time.
3. Formulating and proving theorems that capture the relationships between memes, descriptions, and other concepts central to meme theory. This could involve proving results about the existence, uniqueness, or other properties of memes and descriptions, as well as results about the ways in which memes interact with each other and with other cultural phenomena.
4. Establishing connections between meme theory and other areas of mathematics or related fields. This could involve showing how the concepts and methods of meme theory can be applied to or integrated with other mathematical or conceptual frameworks, or demonstrating how meme theory can contribute to the understanding of broader phenomena or questions.
5. Developing a mathematical framework for analyzing the social and cultural aspects of memes. This could involve incorporating ideas and methods from sociology, anthropology, psychology, or other disciplines that study human culture and social behavior, and using these tools to investigate the roles that memes play in shaping social norms, values, and practices.

Overall, making meme theory a formal mathematical framework would require significant further development and integration of various mathematical and conceptual tools and techniques, as well as a sustained effort to identify and clarify the underlying principles and structures that govern the behavior of memes and their relationships with other cultural phenomena.
